section.title: Service types in the Service catalog
section.para: Every service listed in the service catalog is associated with a service type. You can use the service type to recognize services that perform similar functions, whatever those services are named. The following table shows all the available service types and provides information about any related OpenStack services. To learn more about any of the Rackspace services listed, see the Rackspace developer documentation.

td.para: Services of this type provide managed VMs and bare-metal servers in the cloud.
Cloud Servers is the name of a Rackspace service of this type. This Rackspace service is compatible with the OpenStack Compute (Nova) API 1.1 as documented at http://nova.openstack.org/.
Services of this type provide authentication, authorization, administration, and audit capabilities to provision and manage users that request access to Rackspace Cloud service endpoints.
Cloud Identity is the name of the Rackspace service of this type. The Rackspace service is compatible with OpenStack Keystone API 2.0 as documented at http://keystone.openstack.org/.
Services of this type offer retrieval, storage, and metadata assignment for Rackspace Cloud Server images.
Cloud Images is the name of the Rackspace service of this type. The Rackspace service is compatible with the OpenStack Glance API as documented at http://glance.openstack.org/.
Services of this type provide scalable cloud object storage for files and media.
Cloud Files is the name of the Rackspace service of this type. The Rackspace service is compatible with the OpenStack Swift API as documented at http://swift.openstack.org/.
Services of this type enable you to create isolated networks that provision server instances with Rackspace networks or the isolated networks you create.

Rackspace supports two services of this type: Cloud Networks, which is compatible with the OpenStack Networking service and the nova-network component of the Rackspace Cloud Servers API, which is compatible with the network component of the OpenStack Nova API.
Services of this type provide online object storage for files and allow customers to mount drives or volumes to their Rackspace Next Generation Cloud Servers™.
Cloud BlockStorage is the name of a Rackspace service of this type. The Rackspace service is built on the OpenStack Cinder project.
Services of this type enable you to define policies to dynamically scale cloud resources in response to changing workloads.
Auto Scale is the name of a Rackspace service of this type.
Services of this type enable you to create and manage backup versions of cloud server files and folders that you select, and to restore files to their original location or to another server.
Cloud Backup is the name of a Rackspace service of this type.
Services of this type provide on-demand Apache Hadoop service available in the Rackspace Cloud that enable you to deploy, manage, and scale Hadoop clusters.
Cloud BigData is the name of a Rackspace service of this type.
Services of this type provide fast, scalable, fully managed MySQL databases in the Rackspace Cloud.
Cloud Databases is the name of a Rackspace service of this type.
Services of this type simplify and automate DNS management.
Cloud DNS is the name of a Rackspace service of this type.
Services if this type enable customers on the Rackspace public cloud to access and collect near real-time usage and system event data that can be used for analysis, monitoring, and automation.
Cloud Feeds is the name of a Rackspace service of this type.
Services of this type provide on-demand, scalable traffic management.
Cloud Load Balancers is the name of a Rackspace Cloud service of this type.
Services of this type allow users to collect and analyze various metrics and to quickly iterate through the data with queries and set up dashboard metrics for ongoing metrics monitoring.
Cloud Metrics is the name of a Rackspace service of this type.
Services of this type enable you to create custom infrastructure monitoring with real-time alerts, always-on notifcations, and flexible configurations.
Cloud Monitoring is the name of a Rackspace service of this type.
Services of this type enable you to distribute content globally in order to optimize response times for users accessing web page and media content.
Content Delivery Network (CDN) is the name of a Rackspace service of this type.
Services of this type enable you to automate and standardize cloud infrastructure setup and management.
Cloud Orchestration is the name of the Rackspace service of this type. The Rackspace service is compatible with the OpenStack Heat API.
Services of this type provide an open source, scalable, and highly available message and notifications service.
Cloud Queues is the name of a Rackspace service of this type.
